meanings.definition: A person who is not actively participating in a game or activity, typically sitting on the bench.
meanings.sent1: During the soccer match, the coach asked the benchwarmers to be ready to substitute if needed.
meanings.sent2: The basketball team's benchwarmers cheered enthusiastically from the sidelines.
meanings.sent3: The benchwarmers joked about starting a card game to pass the time on the bench.
meanings.sent4: In the school play, the benchwarmers played the role of trees, adding depth to the scene.
meanings.sent5: The benchwarmers' support for their teammates was as strong as their desire to play.

meanings.definition: A group of players on a sports team who rarely see playing time.
meanings.sent1: The coach decided to give the benchwarmers a chance to showcase their skills in the final minutes of the game.
meanings.sent2: Despite being benchwarmers, the players maintained a positive attitude and worked hard during practice.
meanings.sent3: The benchwarmers formed a secret handshake to celebrate their camaraderie on the sidelines.
meanings.sent4: The benchwarmers' determination to improve their game was evident in their extra practice sessions.
meanings.sent5: Even though they were benchwarmers, their team spirit never wavered.
